rules.natural: If sterilizing equipment is available, then it is operational.
Either sterilizing equipment is available or, whenever technician 1 is trained in aseptic technique, they are certified in sterile processing.
Under the condition that the active ingredient passes quality control, production of batch 1 is approved.
If the excipient passes quality control, then production of batch 2 is approved.
Given that the formulation meets specification, either the active ingredient passes quality control or the excipient passes quality control.
Whenever the formulation is within variance, either the active ingredient passes quality control or the excipient passes quality control.
In the event that the manufacturing process is compliant with FDA regulations, the formulation meets specification or is within variance.
Either the manufacturing process deviates from standard procedure or it is compliant with FDA regulations.
Provided that corrective action is issued by the quality manager, the manufacturing process does not deviate from standard procedure.
Either corrective action is issued by the quality manager or investigation is initiated by the quality manager.
If investigation is initiated by the quality manager, then an audit is scheduled by the quality manager.
Provided that an audit is scheduled by the quality manager, the manufacturing process does not deviate from standard procedure.
If production of batch 1 is approved, then either the impurity level exceeds tolerance or, whenever the sterilization process is not validated, the raw materials are contaminated.

In the event that production of batch 2 is approved, either the impurity level exceeds tolerance, or under the condition that the sterilization process is not validated, the raw materials are contaminated.
If technician 1 has GMP certification, then whenever production of batch 1 is not approved and production of batch 2 is not approved, production of the test batch is rejected.
Provided that technician 1 follows the cleaning protocol, the sterilization process is validated.
Under the condition that technician 1 is certified in sterile processing, they follow the cleaning protocol.
If it is not the case that sterilizing equipment being available implies it is not operational, then maintenance is scheduled for sterilizing equipment.
Provided that it is not the case that sterilizing equipment being available implies it is not operational, then maintenance is not scheduled for sterilizing equipment.
If production of batch 1 is not approved and production of batch 2 is not approved, then production of the test batch is not rejected.
If the sterilization process is not validated, then the raw materials are not contaminated.

facts.natural: Technician 1 is trained in aseptic technique.
The impurity level does not exceed tolerance.

The sterilization process is validated.

The manufacturing process does not deviate from standard procedure.
The manufacturing process is compliant with FDA regulations.
The formulation meets specification or is within variance.
Either the active ingredient passes quality control or the excipient passes quality control.
Production of batch 1 is approved or production of batch 2 is approved.
Either the impurity level exceeds tolerance or, if the sterilization process is not validated, then the raw materials are contaminated.

(A10 → A11).natural: If sterilizing equipment is available, then it is operational.

(A10 → ¬A11).natural: Provided that sterilizing equipment is available, it is not operational.

(A10 ∨ (A8 → A9)).natural: Either sterilizing equipment is available or, whenever technician 1 is trained in aseptic technique, they are certified in sterile processing.

(A13 → A3).natural: Under the condition that the active ingredient passes quality control, production of batch 1 is approved.

(A13 ∨ A14).natural: Either the active ingredient passes quality control or the excipient passes quality control.

(A14 → A4).natural: If the excipient passes quality control, then production of batch 2 is approved.

(A15 → (A13 ∨ A14)).natural: Given that the formulation meets specification, either the active ingredient passes quality control or the excipient passes quality control.

(A15 ∨ A16).natural: The formulation meets specification or is within variance.

(A16 → (A13 ∨ A14)).natural: Whenever the formulation is within variance, either the active ingredient passes quality control or the excipient passes quality control.

(A17 → (A15 ∨ A16)).natural: In the event that the manufacturing process is compliant with FDA regulations, the formulation meets specification or is within variance.

(A18 ∨ A17).natural: Either the manufacturing process deviates from standard procedure or it is compliant with FDA regulations.

(A19 → ¬A18).natural: Provided that corrective action is issued by the quality manager, the manufacturing process does not deviate from standard procedure.

(A19 ∨ A20).natural: Either corrective action is issued by the quality manager or investigation is initiated by the quality manager.

(A2 ∨ (¬G → A1)).natural: Either the impurity level exceeds tolerance or, if the sterilization process is not validated, then the raw materials are contaminated.

(A20 → A21).natural: If investigation is initiated by the quality manager, then an audit is scheduled by the quality manager.

(A21 → ¬A18).natural: Provided that an audit is scheduled by the quality manager, the manufacturing process does not deviate from standard procedure.

(A3 → (A2 ∨ (¬G → A1))).natural: If production of batch 1 is approved, then either the impurity level exceeds tolerance or, whenever the sterilization process is not validated, the raw materials are contaminated.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: Production of batch 1 is approved or production of batch 2 is approved.

(A4 → (A2 ∨ (¬G → A1))).natural: In the event that production of batch 2 is approved, either the impurity level exceeds tolerance, or under the condition that the sterilization process is not validated, the raw materials are contaminated.

(A6 → (¬(A3 ∨ A4) → A5)).natural: If technician 1 has GMP certification, then whenever production of batch 1 is not approved and production of batch 2 is not approved, production of the test batch is rejected.

(A7 → G).natural: Provided that technician 1 follows the cleaning protocol, the sterilization process is validated.
